spectrometer_uv.documentation: Spectrometer in uv light range diagnostic

spectrometer_uv.channel.documentation: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera)

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].aperture[:].c.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].aperture[:].g.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].aperture[:].o.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.
Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].aperture[:].r.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2
Index in the error_description list for "radius"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].aperture[:].s.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data
Index in the error_description list for "surface"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].aperture[:].x.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.documentation: Description of the front face of the micro channel plate

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.cent.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.geom.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.outl.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.
Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.radi.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2
Index in the error_description list for "radius"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.surf.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data
Index in the error_description list for "surface"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.x1_u.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.x1_w.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.x2_u.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.x2_w.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector.x3_u.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector_layo.documentation: Total detector dimension in each direction (horizontal, vertical)
Index in the error_description list for "detector_dimensions"
Pixel dimension in each direction (horizontal, vertical)
Index in the error_description list for "pixel_dimensions"
Number of pixels in each direction (horizontal, vertical)

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].detector_posi.documentation: In case of detector moving during a pulse, position parameter allowing to record and compute the detector position as a function of time
Index in the error_description list for "data"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].exposure_time.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "exposure_time"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.centr.documentation: Centre of the grating sphere (if grating is spherical) or torus (if grating is toric)
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.curva.documentation: Curvature radius of the spherical grating
Index in the error_description list for "curvature_radius"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.geome.documentation: Grating geometry. Index = 1 : spherical. Index = 2 : toric
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.groov.documentation: Number of grooves per unit length
Index in the error_description list for "groove_density"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.image.documentation: Surface on which the grating image is focused
Centre of the image surface in case it is spherical, or position of a point on the surface in case it is a plane
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Curvature radius of the image surface
Index in the error_description list for "curvature_radius"
Surface geometry. Index = 1 : spherical. Index = 2 : plane
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the surface ( in case it is plane) and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.outli.documentation: List of the 4 extreme points of the spherical grating in the (X1, X2) coordinate system, using the summit as the origin. Do NOT repeat the first point.
Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.summi.documentation: Position of the grating summit (defined as the point of contact of its concave side if the grating were put on a table). Used as the origin of the x1, x2, x3 vectors defined below
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.type.documentation: Grating type. Index = 1 : ruled. Index = 2 : holographic

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.type..documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.x1_un.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is horizontal and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.x2_un.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].grating.x3_un.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the grating at its summit and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].intensity_spe.documentation: Intensity spectrum (not calibrated), i.e. number of photoelectrons detected by unit time by a wavelength pixel of the channel, taking into account electronic gain compensation and channels relative calibration
Index in the error_description list for "data"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points. The 2nd point is allowed to evolve in case of dynamic line of sight.
Amplitude of the line of sight position parameter oscillation (in case moving_mode/index = 1)
Index in the error_description list for "amplitude_parameter"
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"
Moving mode of the line of sight. Index = 0 : no movement, fixed position. Index = 1 : oscillating
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.
Period of the line of sight oscillation (in case moving_mode/index = 1)
Index in the error_description list for "period"
In case of line of sight moving during a pulse, position parameter allowing to record and compute the line of sight position as a function of time
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Position of the second point (possibly dynamic)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].processed_lin.documentation: Non-calibrated intensity (integrated over the spectrum for this line)
Index in the error_description list for "data"
String identifying the processed line. To avoid ambiguities, the following syntax is used : element with ionization state_wavelength in Angstrom (e.g. WI_4000)
Calibrated, background subtracted radiance (integrated over the spectrum for this line)
Index in the error_description list for "data"
Central wavelength of the processed line
Index in the error_description list for "wavelength_central"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].radiance_cali.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radiance_calibration"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].radiance_spec.documentation: Calibrated spectral radiance (radiance per unit wavelength)
Index in the error_description list for "data"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].supply_high_v.documentation: Set of high voltage power supplies applied to various parts of the diagnostic
Name of the object connected to the power supply
Voltage set at the power supply
Index in the error_description list for "data"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].validity_time.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for each wavelength and each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].wavelength_ca.documentation: Wavelength calibration data. The wavelength is obtained from the pixel index k by: wavelength =  k * gain + offset. k is starting from 1.
Index in the error_description list for "gain"
Index in the error_description list for "offset"

spectrometer_uv.channel[:].wavelengths_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "wavelengths"

spectrometer_uv.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

spectrometer_uv.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

spectrometer_uv.code.library[:].paramete.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

spectrometer_uv.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

spectrometer_uv.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

spectrometer_uv.etendue.documentation: Etendue (geometric extent) of the optical system

spectrometer_uv.etendue_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "etendue"

spectrometer_uv.etendue_method.documentation: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods

spectrometer_uv.etendue_method.index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.creation_.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.homogeneo.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.occurrenc.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.plugins.documentation: Information about the plugins used to write/read this IDS. This structure is filled automatically by the Access Layer at GET/PUT time, no need to fill it via a user program.

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.plugins.i.documentation: Plugin infrastructure used to GET the data
Plugin infrastructure used to PUT the data

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.plugins.n.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which a plugin has been applied

Plugins actually used to read back a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, listed in reverse order of application). This information is filled by the plugin infrastructure during the GET operation.
List of the code specific parameters in XML format
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the plugin applies to the whole IDS.
Plugins used to PUT a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, if so they are listed by order of application)
List of the code specific parameters in XML format
Plugins to be used to read back a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, listed in reverse order of application)
List of the code specific parameters in XML format

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.provenanc.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documenting provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS.

List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier, see syntax in the link below) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources.

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

spectrometer_uv.ids_properties.version_p.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

spectrometer_uv.latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network.

spectrometer_uv.latency_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "latency"
